news.title: Three buildings in Jaipur sealed for illegal construction
news.para: Jaipur Municipal Corporation sealed properties in Ramganj Bazaar and Johari Bazaar for illegal construction and unauthorized commercial activities. Despite prior notices, property owners and shopkeepers failed to comply, leading to strict enforcement action. The JMC reiterated its stance against such violations in the city.

news.title: Ghaziabad: Illegal colonies on 13 hectares of Yamuna floodplain razed
news.para: Ghaziabad administration conducted a major demolition drive in Loni tehsil, razing illegal colonies spread over 13.5 hectares on Yamuna floodplains. District Magistrate Ravindra Kumar Mandar directed task forces to curb land mafia, following violations of land-use norms and previous warnings to defaulters.

news.title: Chandigarh administration's 2023 notification set to ease norms for CHB residents
news.para: Chandigarh residents living in CHB houses will soon get relief. The administration plans to reintroduce a notification allowing regularisation of need-based changes. This move will benefit over 3.5 lakh people. A fresh notification is expected by the end of January. Compoundable violations will be permitted. Residents must adhere to safety rules. A committee is reviewing the notification for approval.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh notifies subsidy SOPs to attract GCCs
news.para: Uttar Pradesh has notified detailed standard operating procedures offering front-end land subsidies to eligible Global Capability Centres (GCCs). Incentives range from 30% to 50% based on region, aiming to attract investment, create jobs, and reduce disparities. The policy promotes long-term infrastructure development and includes safeguards for timely project execution.

news.title: Over 99% e-khata applications cleared: Greater Bengaluru authority data
news.para: Bengaluru's e-khata system is proving highly effective, with over 99% of 9.1 lakh applications processed city-wide. While mutation processing caused some delays, particularly in West and South zones, overall disposal rates remain exceptionally high. The system demonstrates a maturing digital property documentation process, with an average pendency of just two days.

news.title: Delhi: Demolition of Signature View Apartments on hold for proof
news.para: Delhi Development Authority's plan to demolish and rebuild Signature View Apartments is temporarily halted as the CBI probes alleged construction irregularities. The agency has requested a no-objection certificate before demolition, citing the need to collect evidence on building quality. DDA is incurring significant monthly costs for displaced residents while awaiting the CBI's clearance.

news.title: Lemon Tree rejigs group structure; Warburg Pincus to invest up to ₹960 crore in Fleur Hotels
news.para: Lemon Tree Hotels is restructuring into two focused businesses. One will manage hotels, the other will own and develop them. Warburg Pincus is investing significantly in the ownership arm, Fleur Hotels. Fleur Hotels will be listed separately. The entire process is expected to conclude within 12 to 15 months.

news.title: Delhi: ITC Hotels gets land allotment on lease basis at Yashobhoomi in Dwarka
news.para: ITC Hotels will develop a new five-star hotel at Yashobhoomi in Dwarka. The company has leased land for 91 years and will pay a premium of Rs 326.50 crore. This new property will offer hospitality and banqueting facilities.

news.title: Akzo Nobel India appoints Parth Jindal as chairman
news.para: Akzo Nobel India has welcomed Parth Jindal as its new Chairman, a move aimed at bolstering its leadership. On the same note, the board has sanctioned Rajiv Rajgopal’s elevation to Joint Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer effective January 9, 2026.

news.title: Odisha to complete 48,000 unfinished PMAY-U houses
news.para: Odisha will complete over 48,000 incomplete PMAY-U houses. The Union ministry clarified that states must bear any spillover costs after the Dec 31, 2025, scheme deadline. Odisha has already completed 1.36 lakh houses under the scheme, with a 73% success rate, driven by initiatives like the '100 Days Challenge'.

news.title: Gurugram: ED chargesheets Ocean Seven Buildtech's promoter in PMAY housing 'fraud' case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has launched a formal chargesheet against Swaraj Singh Yadav, the mastermind behind Ocean Seven Buildtech Pvt Ltd. This legal move is tied to an extensive money laundering investigation involving alleged financial deceit against homebuyers enrolled in the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana.

news.title: Gurugram civic body's year-end property tax drive nets ₹30 crore in 45 days
news.para: Gurugram's Municipal Corporation has intensified its property tax recovery, collecting Rs 30 crore in the last 1.5 months and exceeding its annual target. The civic body sealed 55 properties and issued 410 notices to defaulters. Efforts are now focused on identifying commercial activities in residential areas to boost revenue.

news.title: MPCB shuts 10 ready-mix concrete plants across Mumbai region
news.para: Authorities have cracked down on air pollution in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region, shutting down 10 ready-mix concrete plants and collecting Rs 84 lakh in fines over two days. Inspections revealed numerous violations of environmental and dust-control norms. Seventeen plants received show-cause notices, and five construction sites faced proposed directions for non-compliance, highlighting ongoing efforts to improve air quality.

news.title: Chandigarh administration is set to overhaul building bylaws to boost industrial growth
news.para: Chandigarh is set to overhaul its building bylaws to boost industrial growth, with a key reform increasing the permissible floor area ratio (FAR) for industrial plots. Architectural controls will be replaced by zoning parameters for smaller plots, aiming to reduce land loss and enhance competitiveness. The administration is also finalizing plans for the undeveloped Industrial Area Phase III.

news.title: Sumadhura Group invests ₹1,000 crore to develop six residential projects in Bengaluru
news.para: Sumadhura Group is investing ₹1,000 crore in six new residential projects across East and North Bengaluru. These developments are planned for completion by FY26. The projects will offer over 4,000 residential units and more than 400 plots.

news.title: Bengaluru development body razes ‘illegal’ houses in Saraipalya
news.para: Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) demolished approximately 22 'illegal' properties, including godowns and residential sheds, on two acres of notified BDA land in Saraipalya, Thanisandra. Residents, however, claim over 60 structures were torn down, with some presenting property documents and questioning the sudden action.

news.title: Keystone Realtors'  sales bookings down 3% to ₹837 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Keystone Realtors has reported a slight dip in sales bookings for the third quarter. However, the company has achieved growth over the first nine months of the financial year. The company launched one project in the quarter and five projects in the nine-month period.
